name: Current Second Years

body: Some people might describe this as an absolute beast of a room, and they'd probably be wrong. However, it is a very nice room, though oddly shaped, with a **diagonal** wall that upon first inhabiting the room will **mess with your mind**. After adjusting to the concept of diagons, you'll find that you've got a tranquil number at the very end of the college building with a nice view across the gardens. There's a decent balcony too, and you can see onto Adams Road and some netball courts too. There's also a second window/door to a fire exit area, which essentially doubles up as a second balcony, though anyone can enter it from the staircase. A large amount of overhead storage makes up for having only 4 shelves and also there is a quite simply **outstandingly brilliant** kettle, which can **bubble, bubble** without any **toil and trouble** to make you a good cup of tea or coffee day or night!
name: S5

body: I *love* this room. I think it's perfect for any gym enthusiast. Plenty of floor space so perfect for anyone looking to get the burn going doing reps of press ups, plank and of course side scramp. Really allows you to build up the craduloids and the flannids. Musician below which means free work out music, and trust me that **really** helps when you're just trying to power through the last few mins of a daily workout. Bit low on natural light.
name: D7

body:
As it is a value room, it is smaller than most college rooms. But do not despair there is still enough room to stand up and move without hitting your head. You could also swing a cat, but it would have to be a rather patient cat that didn't mind being hit on the head a bit. It has excellent in term storage but no out of term storage. Your room has a wardrobe , two spacious cuboards and a big storage gap under the window seat. You also have the top of the window seat which can be used for sitting on, curling up on, sleeping on, etc the possibilities are endless.( As long as they can fit into about a square meter, thus setting up an airport is probably out). The room comes with two chairs a working chair and a relaxing chair. The room would be more spacious without the big chair, but for all you people with at least 1 friend that hates sitting on beds. This is the room for you. Location wise its close enough to get to college easilly but far enough away that you can work without noise even when a big ent is on. The bathroom is between 4 but on the other hand it is as bigger than your room and space will not be an issue. An excellent feature of this room is that it has a kitchen on the same floor, allowing for easy food access. The kitchen is small but if your entertaining there is a much larger kitchen on the ground floor.

Thus this room would suit a shortish, friendless person with a love of cooking and no desire to set up a room based airport.

Though tall people would not have a massive problem and could go to thier friends room when meeting. So don't not pick it on that account.

Also think of all the extra drink / cake / hats / photographs of people called kenneth you could buy with the money saved by having a value room.
name: Room 12

body:
Small cupboard above wardrobe for holiday storage.
The room has very creaky floors (as does L12) but a picture-perfect view of the lake.
name: L11

body: Nice standard fresher room, good view of garden. Plenty of space, tiny balcony (big enough to chill beer in winter provided your balcony mate doesn't nick it). Kitchen upstairs is pretty tiny and stairs are a bit of a pain, but not as bad as some other staircases. Bed seems to get put facing into room, if you put it against the wall you get much more space.
name: M11

body: I11 has a shared balcony, and lockable cupboard for storing things during vacations. The kitchen is up one floor (or down two). It's one of those L shaped rooms. Unfortunately, there's (next to?) no wifi reception.
name: I11

body: Noise from the bar, noise from the bop room, noise from the walkway, noise from drunken people lingering around the staircase outside P. There's some weird dripping noise within the walls and also engine sounds from on top(I genuinely don't know why). Nice morning light. Nice and friendly bedder. Opposite the nurse office. You can crawl your way there if you fall sick.
name: P1

body: Decent size and never a problem with noise. Very nice view over the gardens. Small balcony shared with someone on E staircase (I think). Wardrobe with mirror on inside of door. Kitchen up one flight of stairs. Lugging stuff up 3 flights of stairs at beginning of term not the most fun I've ever had...
name: D17

body: This room is nice and large, it is on one of the bends in college so has slightly more room than normal room hence being "best". To give an idea of size during conference periods this room has two beds and is sold as a twin. The room was refurbised for October 2011 so has a very nice bath room though the shower hose is a little short. The wifi signal is variable across the room ranging from perfect to weak. There are two network ports. The french windows to the balcony lie at one end of the room leading to one end being nice and bright and the other quite dingy. Unfortunately the desk and the pinboard are at the diny end of the room, though housekkeping don't mind if you rearrange the furniture. There is a sizavle overhead locker for vacation storage and being at the end of college the room is very quiet.  Shares balcony with Q6 - nice pair of rooms, and are mirror images of each other.
name: R6 (Guest Room)

body: A very decent room for a standard. It's a good size, and gets a fair amount of light from the two windows in the day time (although its overhead electric light is a bit weak, so it can get rather dim in the evenings). The room does look out over the car park, which isn't a fantastic view, but there's very little disturbance from the road, as Sylvester Road is pretty quiet. It doesn't share a wall with any other rooms and the soundproofing is pretty good in 1SR, so you barely ever hear anything from other bits of the house. Storage space is a bit limited, but there's a cupboard right outside the room that you can overflow into if you run out.
name: Room 5

body:
Fairly average sized room I think, has a balcony shared with someone on B staircase with a good view of the gardens. The window is set back in the corner so the lighting isn't great in half of the room. Doesn't get Wifi as yet, and there isn't a great deal of holiday storage, just the cupboard above the wardrobe.

Caitlin (crb48)
name: A16

body: Nice room, good view, good size, ensuite. Utterly surrounded by rooms with pianos - all the other rooms on this floor of E have pianos, and the adjacent room in D has one too. Makes for nice background music when doing work, but has yet to be never annoyingly loud. Easy access to gardens by using the door at the very bottom of E.
name: E4

body:
Quite a small room right at the top of J staircase. There is no built-in wardrobe, which means it takes up quite a lot of the floor space. Also an annoying pillar in the corner which makes the room feel quite small. Re-arranging the room a bit makes things a bit better though. Good views over the front courtyard, and the staircase kitchen is on the same level, which is handy. Can be quite hard to get in to the room when you're carrying things as you have to wait for the landing door to close before you can reach the room door. Great balcony, which is probably about 2-3 times the size of the room, with sole access.

Nick Clegg used to live here.
name: J13

body: Garden facing with shared balcony, has a large wardrobe with holiday storage space and gets a reasonable amount of daylight. It's a neatly almost-square shaped room which makes it quite cosy. Radiator works properly (have heard that's not always the case) and has a nice blue felt noticeboard, not one of those horrible orangey ones. Generally a lovely room :)
name: E12

body:
The room has a shared balcony, which, i'm sure, will be more of use in the summer! Large room, plenty of space. It has a 2 door wardrobe with a big cupboard above for vacation storage.
Doesn't get a lot of natural light, despite having a large window and a glass door, as they are kind of recessed away from the room (don't know if that makes sense...).
Unfortunately, even though it is above the bar, you can't get wifi up here. :( There is only ever any noise from the bar if you leave your windows open, but that's never been a problem (why leave the bar before it closes? :P).
In the winter the room is lovely, because it has a massive radiator that warms to room up very well.

Best bit: The view of the garden every morning (especially pretty now it's covered with snow)
name: N11

body:
No balcony, close to restaurant and cafe which is convenient, especially when raining.

A lot of storage space and big wardrobe. Near the kitchen.

Vasilis
name: O4

body: Plenty of sunlight, but sometimes this means that the room can become too warm. During the winter months direct sunlight hits the desk area so curtains need to be drawn until mid afternoon. By the summer, however, the sun is high enough not to cause any bother. The view isn't spectacular- it looks out onto a rooftop but you don't really notice it much. The room shares a balcony with D14. The overhead storage space is more than enough, and the wardrobe is of an average size. The rails to hang suits and shirts etc. is a bit short though. Wi-fi connection very rarely but sometimes with decent signal.
name: E11

body: Its a nice enough room, overhead locker for vacation storage, small wardrobe, shelves etc. The main disadvantage with this room is that it's RIGHT next to the extractor fans from the canteen kitchen. The noise isn't too distracting during the day, but they seem to run constanly between 6am and 11:30pm, so its quite hard to get to sleep. This also means that the balcony is pretty big, unfortunately that means the room shape is a bit strange - one of the corners is missing - and that limits the possible furniture rearrangement, so it can feel smaller than it is. On the plus side, it gets a lot of light, although if its sunny, the light comes strongly onto the desk and so I have to shut the curtains so I don't get blinded. Also, the noise from the party room travels out along bin brook, so you can hear all the tunes in the bop really clearly. Which if you don't want to be at the bop gets annoying around 1am.
name: R10

body:
K4 is a lovely big room, it's painted yellow, and because it's a Best you get nice blue curtains and a matching bedspread. The bath is also not grainy at the bottom, and the bathroom has nice blue and white tiling. You will need a long internet cable, though, as for no apparent reason the socket is on the other side of the room to the desk.

Apart from the occasional noise from parties in J8, the room is very quiet as few people live on K. This is because of the lift, which has the other benefit of making the staircase great for moving in and out.
name: K4

body: Good sized room, convenient (close to bar, canteen, cafe) but no holiday storage space
name: P9

body:
Advantages:

 - Huge Room - fits lots of people, suitable for indoor tennis
 - Easily fits two desks (though only one provided)
 - East, South AND West Facing Windows with a nice view of the garden
 - Nice mantelpiece for ornaments, if you have ornaments (but no fire, sadly)
 - 2 radiators so it doesn't get cold despite the number of windows
 - Next to the kitchen, so feels social/makes snacking easier
 - Opposite a shared loo, sink and internal phone (ooh)

Disadvantages:

 - Showers are on the 1st floor and are shared (3 between 14)
 - Overlooked by 1A Sylvester
 - Next to kitchen, so gets smells and noise
 - There is some IT infrastructure just outside which makes an annoying buzzing sound, and you have an adjoining wall with the boiler (it doesn't often have late-night parties, though)
 - The door buzzer is so loud it makes you ruin your supervision work  when someone wants to come in

General:

 - Living in Sylvester Road does add on an extra 2-3 minutes to every journey to town/college (but if you are based in West Cambridge it is literally perfect)
 - Bike Storage outside the house (but a spate of bike thefts might put you off that)
 - Communal Kitchen is HUGE and has a seating area with brand new solid oak table
 - Communal bathrooms, the shower in which is easily big enough for two (or three, but four is probably pushing social acceptability)
name: Room 4

body:
Ground floor, nice size. Not the best light, and it doesn't have a balcony or window-doors that open onto the walkway - just standard windows. You can kind of get Wi-Fi, but it's not the best connection. It does have a spacious wardrobe and a nicely-sized cupboard above it for storing things over the holiday. Generally very comfortable to live in.

Hilla (hra27)
name: A6

body: Nice room with quite a lot of floor space. Does get quite dark, so you always need a lamp when working, but there's a really nice view onto the garden. It's above a floor of music students, which the person in E9 last years claimed you can hear all the time, but I don't think you can hear it unless you're outside on the staircase, or you've got your ear to the floor. A bit of a way to the kitchen, but the stairs are good for you!
name: E9

body:
I lived in this room 2008-9. It's a value room which means it's on the small side but you do pay less. Storage space is limited as the wardrobe is very small but it's nice and cosy plus it gets all the sunshine during the day. No balcony but nice views of the tree tops from the window plus roof access which makes for excellent views and party location. Plus it makes you suddenly very popular when there are fireworks. (This is all so long as the porters haven't found out about the key). Conveniently oppposite the kitchen although no kitchen cupboard specifically for the room.

Sarah



I'm living in this room at the moment would just like to reiterate everything Sarah has said really. It is small, but it's also cheaper and it's nice having everything quite compact. The roof access is still there and is rather useful for views, fireworks, socialising and beer storage/chilling. Being right next to the kitchen is very handy, especially if you don't sleep much, as you can easily make a 4am snack with less chance of disturbing anyone. It also doesn't share a wall with the other two rooms, so you don't really share their noise. It has no lockable storage cupboard, but that's no problem if you're friends with someone who has.

Martyn.
name: F21

body: There is a locker for holiday storage. The room is L shaped and rather large, although the bed placement takes up a lot of room; much better when turned 90 degrees and moved against wall.
name: L10

body:
Great room. Quite recently refurbished, pretty big but probably a normal standard plus room really, has a holiday storage locker, wardrobe's pretty small but that's no big deal. No mirror in the main room but it's on the 'waiting list' to get one, nice soft blue felt notice board (I know that sounds weird but its nice not having a horrible hard one when I like to cover it in stuff)...erm, the last person said it seemed hard to heat, but I've found it's been easy to keep it nice and warm except for when it got REALLY cold. 
Oh, and HUGE bonus, it's directly opposite the side gate into college so moving in and out is as easy as it could be I think!
On the whole, I've loved this room and would happily choose it again, hope whoever gets it next enjoys it! (P.s. that red stain on the wall behind the towel rail isn't blood, it's red hair dye...my bad!)
name: B6

body: Opposite the flats so can get noisy but this isn't too bad. Generally an all right room, especially as it has a piano and is ground floor. Not too big but fine. 2 door cupboard and lockable space above. Wifi has a very poor signal, but a long ethernet cable reaches the desk. There is an annoying gurgling in the pipes directly behind the bed some nights, but again it's not too bad. Good in Winter, as seems to heat up better than other rooms. Overall, a good room.
name: E3

body: Very noisy wind whistles through the door and the floor boards are creaky. Nice view though.
name: O13

body:
Advantages: A spacious room with plenty of wardrobe space. Good views of the garden. Balcony, rather than a walkway, outside the window.

Disadvantages: No direct sunlight, so the room can be a little gloomy on cloudy days. On the other hand, there are no issues with sun shining on your laptop screen or the room getting really hot. No wi-fi signal at the moment.
name: D12

body: A nice room overlooking the roof of the Auditorium, H7 is pretty much identical to all of the garden facing rooms on this level (and the level below). There is a private balcony, one flight of stairs down to the kitchen, and handy for the Auditorium, Games Room, Library and Plodge. However, H staircase does not extend to the ground floor and must be accesses via the first or second floor walkways on the college side.
name: H7

body: A4 is a lot smaller than many of the other standard plus rooms I have seen. It gets hardly any natural light as the view from the window is a large tree. The radiator in the room doesn't seem to regulate the temperature very well either. It is either too hot or too cold. There is a fellow's room right next door so you have to be careful with loud music. There is no separate balcony, it just leads straight onto the main balcony. On the plus side, there is a cupboard above the wardrobe for extra storage. No wireless internet as A staircase is a bit far out.
name: A4

body: Nice spacious room with ensuite. Small-ish wardrobe, but a lockable storage cupboard above it that comes in very handy for the holidays. Kitchen is two floors below which can sometimes be a pain. Room faces out on to a walkway. This is nice when friends walk past to chat etc, less nice when they walk past and bang on your window when drunk. Room is generally quite dark in the day, but gets lighter at night when the walkway light comes on right outside the window. Also quite often an annoying clicking noise coming from the pipes in the bathroom which is pretty disturbing when trying to sleep/work.
name: C7

body: O3 has a piano. But it's flat.
name: O3

body:
This room is a fair size so long as the furniture is arranged to make best use of space. A reasonable amount of storage space during term, with a large wardrobe and separate chest of drawers but no lockable cupboards so nothing for the vacation. SW facing window so plenty of daylight, and the view is over the gardens. Small single balcony. As far as I know the room doesn't get Wifi. This and several other rooms on S staircase (and probably others nearby facing the garden) tend to get a fair number of small flies and ladybirds coming in, especially in warmer weather and even when the windows are shut.

Adam (as929)
name: S10

body: A very nice, square room, which is very useful in this case. It's excellent value for a value and its shape means that there's plenty of space. Good lighting due to two windows, and north (ish) facing, so doesnt get too much sun, although this can be a disadvantage if you like sun. It has a handy alcove which doesnt take too much space out of the room but which I currently have two suitcases and lots more stored in.
name: Room 11

body:
Cupboard last year, cosy room this year... its lovely tho really.

Shared bathroom off hallway. Front door on balcony overlooking river and backdoor of Set 24. ;)
name: Set 21b

body: I14 is a lovely room. Your view of the gardens is super nice and, because you are on the highest floor, you get a shared balcony AND a fire-escape (which is really just a tiny balcony meant to be used as a mini-fridge in the winter). Bathroom is not refurbished but fine. There is no overhead storage. Phone signal is really amazing and WiFi is not bad either. It's not a huge room and the second chair will always be awkwardly placed either in front of your wardrobe or your balcony door, but whaddaya do?
name: I14

body: Garden facing, shared balcony with room C12. Gets plenty of daylight (standard floor-to-ceiling window/door), but the sun rarely gets round here except during the summer months, so doesn't get a lot of sunlight or natural heat. No WiFi at the moment. Decent overhead locker space for vacation storage, wardrobe is nice and big - three doors wide rather than two. Handy shelf in the bathroom for storing bits and bobs. The taps are a bit leaky unless you twist them pretty hard, and it gets quite cold next to the balcony door because there is no double-glazing. The room stays pretty warm with the radiator on low though, because of the other rooms around it.
name: B13

body: THIS ROOM HATES PHONES. Getting any signal at all will become a huge achievement. But you eventually become used to it/give up. Get Whatsapp. And your view outside your window is of the court rather than the garden meaning when people get home at 3am it can be noisy right outside. The piano is in quite bad condition: the pedals don't work and some of the keys are in need of repair but other than that the room is quite good. It's not as wide as some other standard plus rooms and some of the sockets are awkwardly placed behind the piano but it has a decent-sized lockable storage cupboard above the big wardrobe and it has good central heating and shelf space. Oh but you're right next to the bedder's storage room. Learn to love waking up to shouting/the radio at 8am every weekday. At least the wi-fi's quite good.
name: E6

body: A decent sized room with nice views of the garden. There's a shared balcony with H13, which isn't huge but will be good in warmer weather, and an emergency exit balcony to I13. Plenty of storage space with a big wardrobe. It's opposite the kitchen which is nice and convenient. No lockable storage in the room but H14's cupboard in the kitchen can be locked with a padlock. The desk area can get a little chilly as it's by the balcony door/window which is a bit drafty.
name: H14

body:
**Positives**: En-suite, decent size , overhead locker, shelf under mirror in bathroom, shower over bath. Quiet part of the college.

**Negatives**: Pale cream coloured walls, lack of natural light due to facing college, exactly furthest away from both of the staircase kitchens as midway between them. Really bad view. Also you have to deal with people walking constantly across your window.

There are definitely better rooms.
name: D10

body: A lovely room - it is on the top floor, which can be a bit annoying, but it keeps you fit. Nice balcony, shared with M14, with genuinely the best view in college, as it is right in the middle, so you can see right across the whole garden. The bathroom is fine etc. It's right opposite the kitchen which is good in terms of making your breakfast.
name: M13

body: no holiday storage facilities.
name: R9

body:
A nice space with a lovely view over the gardens but has limited natural light(with a fairly big window too). Has a sink.
Shares a bathroom with 4 other rooms and two toilets between 9 others. Although this sounds like quite a lot of people it is quite manageable.
The big kitchen on this floor comes with a dining table and is a good socializing area.
name: Room 16

body: Palatial room...so jealous
name: Room 3

body: R7 is a really big room, much bigger than R8. It's also got a new springy-carpet as well.
name: R7

body:
A great room for the price, the lockable cupboard is huge, I fitted tow people stuff and more in there and there was still room for me to climb in and rearrange it all. 

Its a lovely warm room though it is a bit dark as there is only a small window. Because of its shape it can be difficult to arrange furniture but if you get it right it feels really nice and cosy.

There is a low ceiling on the way up the stairs but only really an issue if your over 5'8" or wear really high heels. 

The kitchens in the house are far better than college but some of the other houses have nicer ones.

There are 2 shower/baths and one bath and one shower in the house and 5 toilets so there's almost always one free. Top floor has a bath but there is a sloped roof over the top so need to watch your head when you stand up.
name: Room 13

body:
The main special feature of this room is it's right above the bar, meaning you get a lot of noise at busy times. It has its advantages though - there's really good WiFi signal, you can hear when the bar is busy (just hope it isn't for a society dinner full of people you don't know) and you can get down there without getting wet. But don't even think about getting any work done on Friday or Saturday nights.

Daylight isn't great as your window (which opens on to the garden walkway, by the way) both has net curtains, which you probably want to leave up, and is shaded by the balcony from the room above.

There's a big 3-door wardrobe with a nice big lockable cupboard above it, but like in many en-suites it's not in your room itself but in the entrance-way which is slightly annoying. Also the wardrobe tends to be quite dark as the door opens blocking the light, so if you're like me and need to differentiate between many subtly different shades of blue clothing, bring something to light it up with.
name: N3

body: Marginally bigger than Q11, lift straight to bops or breakfast, useful for moving in, good views of the garden.
name: Q10

body:
nice size and shape
next to kitchen so a bit noisy- good if you get up early, not if you live near rowers
very small wardrobes
not much daylight, but ok if you have lots of lights on
good shower but poor ventilation so room can end up a bit steamy
good view of squirrels prancing/deer
yellow walls
lots of electic sockets
name: C2

body:
It looks like all the other shared bathroom rooms on the third floor. Its above the auditorium, so to get to it you have to go up J staircase, with its really narrow ground floor entrance, which is a bit of a faff if you're carrying a lot of stuff. Doesn't get wi-fi yet, being on the garden side, though next door in I9 does. Garden facing rooms are slightly bigger than the court facing ones, and have the overhead lockable storage, handy for the holidays, so that's a bonus.

I staircase has the advantage of being on one of the staircases closest to the plodge, the laundry room, and all the teaching rooms.

The front doors of I9 and I10 lack the automatic closing mechanisms, so that it is possible to leave both doors open. This is quite nice if you get on well with the person you are sharing with.

At certain times of the year, when the planets align and the clouds part, the sun bounces off the roof of the Needham Research Institute on the other side of Bin Brook, through the trees. This unfortunate reflection is especially inconvenient if you choose to push the desk round to face the window, whereupon the beam of light shines directly at your face while you're trying to stare aimlessly out into space and burns holes in your retinas.
name: I10

body:
Due to facing out into the middle of the gardens, a lot of natural light comes though.

There is a cupboard for holiday storage above the wardrobe, needs a padlock to be brought separately.

No kitchen on 3rd floor, need to go upstairs to 4th floor kitchen.

Any questions can be sent to me at dmr46@cam.ac.uk.
name: O11

body: One of the smallest rooms in college (but in the standard rent band), located on a corner so everyone can see in to your room, plenty of windows but unfortunate placing of the mirror means the only way to avoid being dazzled on bright days is to shut all your curtains. Has a nice balcony but I heard that a previous occupant did something terrible on it to desecrate it. Has a ceiling hatch which means you have tons of storage space for the vacation which is nice. Shower suffers from really poor water pressure and erratic temperature control.
name: R14

body:
First off, this is a 'value' room, so don't expect an en-suite, or much space.
That said, the bathroom door is directly opposite this room, so the walk to the bathroom is only 1m.

Pros:Top floor kitchen, with oven, 2 fridges, a freezer, 4 hobs, microwave and kettle.
Nearby bathroom with excellent shower.
2 large lockable cupboards(set into the roof, so triangular)
-one has shelves in, and a coat hanger rack.
1 large window seat with storage under.
Swively window with blind.
Lovely garden.
Excellent downstairs kitchen.
Laundry room right by house.

Cons:Top floor, so quite a walk when moving in.
It's pretty small - if you like to pace whilst thinking, or swing cats, this is not for you.
Can get hot quickly in summer.

____________

It's really smallllllllll compared to most rooms in college.
name: Room 11

body: Decent amount of holiday storage and hanging space, on the walkway, so no proper balcony, brick facing, so no garden view :( but is exactly 9 (large) paces from the bar, and probably the same from the cafe, I just haven't measured it yet. Can get quite noisy during friday nights, but it's not too much bother because of the early closing time of the bar.
name: N1

body: This room is great for a standard & has a fantastic extra storage nook which no other bathroom-sharing rooms have (as far as I know). Decent balcony not on the walkway, and gets the morning sun. Close to the canteen = v convenient!
name: Q7

body: Had to pay standard for the smaller room which is same size as in other sets which would only ask for value price, otherwise good
name: Set 30a

body: This is quite a large, comfortable room. It has no private balcony, the windows open out onto the long walkway that runs around college on the garden side. Privacy is not an issue though as nobody ever walks past. It also has a large wardrobe with a holiday storage locker. However, very poor television reception.
name: A9

body:
Reasonable sized room with a fair amount of holiday storage in a locker above the wardrobes. It gets Wifi pretty consistently, although with a fairly low signal. Not all that much sunlight, but that does come with the advantage of no sun shining directly onto your PC screen.

The obvious disadvantage is that it's on the ground floor and facing into the college, so noise from people congregating outside the room and talking can be a bit annoying if you're trying to work. Still, that doesn't happen all that often, and I've been happy here.
name: D6

body:
Standard sums it up. Standard layout, standard storage, standard (nice) view of gardens, standard bathroom. Shower is fine, has the usual fits of hot/cold when other people take showers, but not as bad as others. It's on high court, which you may or may not like, but is pretty convenient for bar, garden restaurant and JCR (and music room or nurse's office if they take your fancy?).

Highlights
----------
Lift on Q means much less effort moving in and out if you get a trolly that fits in it.
Can just get wireless (not great signal) if you carefully position laptop. Can't rely on it though, just for those bandwidth quota breaches.

Bad points
----------
Kitchen is a whole floor up and is poor, even as Robinson kitchens go.

Also, it has a name that sounds a bit like a small middle-eastern country.
name: Q8

body: Only a little less floor space than a standard room - it's only really value because of the low ceiling. It probably wouldn't suit anyone really tall who likes to jump but the low ceiling means there's no student-y pin board so feels much more homely. Good housekeeper too so bathrooms and kitchen are always kept clean. Oh and if you have loads of clothes it's also probably not the best room for you due to lack of wardrobe space.
name: Room 16

body: A massive room compared to the rest of the college, with a very nice en suite and decent shower. Opposite the kitchen and has almost immediate access to the gardens. 4 sets of electrical sockets, all sensibly placed around the room. There is holiday storage space, but the hanging space in the wardrobe is limited. The room tends to be quite gloomy, as the window (small compared to room size) looks Northwards and so never really gets the sun. The mirror in the bathroom is poorly located (behind the door). No Wifi. In theory, probably one of the best Standard Plus rooms.
name: B2

body:
It's a regular standard plus room on first floor.

Pros:

 + Spacious storage room.
 + There is place above the sink to put all your stuff.

Cons:

 - Piano player in this staircase. If you can't stand noise i wouldn't suggest this room.
 - Kitchen 2 floors up/down.
name: D9

body: Really nice room, spacious, big wardrobe, garden view, and one of the only bathrooms in college that has tiles (and a heated towel rail)! Kitchen is just downstairs. Only downside is that one of the rooms opposite has a piano which can be quite distracting when you're trying to work...Also the cleaner's cupboard is literally right outside the door and she's pretty loud every morning at 8.30am...Invest in some ear plugs!
name: C5

body:
A pretty standard 3rd floor room. There are no holiday storage facilities in the room. There is good access to Wifi due to its proximity to the library. The room faces over front court and, because it is South East facing, gets a large amount of sun in the mornings, which, on a sunny day, can be strong enough to wake you up. I staircase has no entrance onto Front Court itself, meaning you have to walk up J staircase first in order to get there.

Peter (pjn32)
name: I9

body:
The room is really big and there is a lot of wardrobe/floor/shelf space for term time. There's also a storage locker above the wardrobe for over the holidays. There's a shelf in the bathroom and an inner door separating the bathroom & wardrobe part by the front door from the main room. It's the closest room to the bar and and it's not noisy despite this. But you can hear the bar lift occasionally which could get annoying, I don't really mind it though. 

The kitchen is right next door as well but tiny, the one at the top of the staircase is much bigger. 
Not much of a view, just looks out onto a walkway in college.
The Wifi connection is rubbish, even though you'd have thought being right above the cafe would mean it'd be ok. 

Katerina: kp374
name: O1

body:
Piano: Weber "Duo-Art" (old upright, large, ivory keys have mostly been chipped off)

Longish rectangular room in slightly unusual arrangement: the piano, shelves and desk are on one side; the bed and coffee table are next to the radiator. Large three-door wardrobe with lockable holiday storage above.

Small entrance area connecting with bathroom. Relatively large floorspace especially considering the size of the piano.
name: D3

body: Reasonable sized room, great views down the length of the Gardens, looking out over Thorny Creek Cottage and the pond, shared balcony, plenty of storage space for the holidays (about 1.5x larger than available in many rooms)
name: M7

body: C10 is an good ensuite room in a quieter area of College (whoever wrote this is lying. It's fucking noisy when the lads get back from cindies at 4 in the morning [went via gardies of course] with their gash and head to the flats). The room is very spacious and the window opens onto the walkway which goes along most of the College, which is handy. The bathroom is really nice too. The only slight downside is that occasionally it can be a little dark, but it's absolutely fine with the lights on anyway.
name: C10

body:
Pros: C4 is at the quiet end of College. It has a lovely view out into the trees and across the back of the main building. The walkway is a nice little addition.

Door to the bathroom is off the main room and the cupboard has three bits and a large overhead part. 

Cons: The room isn't overly bright, and sometimes you can smell things when someone's cooking in the kitchen downstairs.
name: C4

body:
A decent sized room (considering it's a fresher room), great eduroam reception :) loads of holiday storage above a big wardrobe, the kitchen is just next door (although the fridge is really small). 

There is a small walkway when u walk into the room, which makes the room even more spacious. 

But in general the room is really big and nice, almost nothing to complain about.
name: I4

body:
Fairly small room but comfortable. Very large amount of storage space. If you have a lot of stuff this could be the room for you! The over head lockable storage is excellent for the holidays and the extra cupboard could (almost literally) sleep 3 people in it.

Positioning of the furniture can be a bit tricky due to the lack of space but can be just about managed reasonably.
name: J12

body: Ground floor, really really noisy because it faces into college. Lots of passersby and drunken groups trooping past - not private. OK size room but Wi-Fi is iffy. Is always noisy in the morning (8/9am) as it's right next to the bedder's cupboard.. and they can be loud. Doesn't let in much light: half the room is always a bit dark, and the front door doesn't close by itself. Kitchen is one floor down. A couple of spiders. Noisiest neighbours ever.
name: F3

body:
Nice room with good open floor space (it's rectangular); all the usual stuff is here and not much else. Balcony shared with E15. Three flights of stairs up so a bit of a pain at the start/end of term, but nice and close to D-staircase top kitchen which is up one more flight. Fairly good view (over Clare Hall) but it doesn't beat the garden. The room gets a lot of direct sunlight in the summer, so much so that you might want to consider moving the desk from its default position next to the window so that you don't go blind. It's great if you're an ardent user of solar-powered calculators. Compared to other rooms on this level, D18 gets very few ladybirds (or indeed other insects), although I was caught off-guard one day when the biggest bee I've ever seen in my life casually blundered through the window.

All in all, the room's pretty good, and I'd recommend it to anyone wanting a normal Standard room. If you want any more info, feel free to email me (cn319), but I don't live here any more, so I can't arrange a visit!

Clive (inhabitant 2009-10)
name: D18

body: With sweeping garden views this room is perfect for people who like to observe trees and grass from a safe distance. Has a nice balcony shared with D staircase, perfect for putting beer on. Kitchen up one flight of stairs; locker above wardrobe for holiday storage. Can get quite dark as there is little direct sunlight. Perfect for vampires or hangovers. The suggestion made by "The Brick" that Satan himself lives here was very much exaggerated.
name: E16

body: Garden facing with a weird main light that means the room is exceptionally bright. It's a good sized ensuite room, sharing a balcony with a room on F, with both the wardrobe and bathroom separate from the main bedroom..The wardrobe is massive with a generously sized over-head locker perfect for holiday storage. The bathroom has a handy shelf for toiletries etc and an awesomely powerful shower, bath's a bit scratchy though. The room itself has quite a few shelves and is a delightful shade of green. The internet cable socket thingy is in a bit of an awkward place under the shelves but you can just about connect a cable to a computer on the desk with a bit of furniture shuffling. Generally really liked it here, any questions email Rhiannon (rll29)
name: E13

body: It is a fair sized ensuite room, garden facing and shares its balcony, 2nd floor with E staircase. The network connection socket is on the other side of the room compared with the desk, but with a long cable it's fine. There is no mobile signal unless you stand on the balcony. There is a good amount of overhead locker storage, but unfortunately the kitchen is 2 floors above.
name: F12

body:
Really nice room, right above the bar (you don't have to go out in the rain to get a drink!) and with access to the massive balcony above the gardens. Wardrobe is larger than others with twice as much hanger space.

You often get the smell of smoke coming upstairs from people just outside the bar and the radiator is very noisy if on at about 12:30am and 5:30am when the heating cycles for the night. Woke me up quite a lot in Michaelmas. You can hear formal hall going on underneath you quite a lot as well as some bar noise.

Kitchen proximity is definitely convenient as well.
name: N2

body:
G3 is a good size ensuite room. The bathroom also seems to be a fair bit larger than other ensuites which I have been in. There is a large wardrobe with drawer storage and shelving built in, along with a large amount of holiday storage space above it.

The desk is located on the same side of the room as the internet connection. Not sure whether you can get Wi-Fi here, as I don't use it, but I have a feeling you can just about get it...though probably not particularly reliably! The radiator is behind the desk, which makes it fairly...rubbish. It can, therefore, get chilly from time to time. That said, it never gets particularly bad.

The window/door opens up onto the first balcony above Front Court. This lets in a good amount of light, however it can be slightly noisy at times, especially as the bed is situated next to the window, and there's not really anywhere else for it. If you are a particularly light sleeper, this may not be for you, as you can hear fellow students returning from alcohol-fuelled revelry fairly regularly! Also, as shown on the staircase description, there is the games room on the floor below. This isn't usually an issue, except when Tai Chi classes are going on, when regular stamps on the floor and shouting are audible!

As for the general location in relation to other things, there is a kitchen on the floor, though it is particularly small, even by Robinson kitchen standards (though not as small as the one a couple of flights up!). The staircase is of course opposite the library, plodge and laundry/computer room area, which is handy. The staircase description mentions the theatre as something you might hear, but I have never noticed it except in the case of the exeptionally loud (but brilliant) Korean drumming sessions. Last of all, it only shares a wall with one room in the next staircase (unless you count the cleaning room located behind the bathroom!).

So, a short summary:

Pros
----

+ Fairly large, comfortable room
+ Recieves quite a bit of light
+ Very large storage space and wardrobe
+ Bigger-than-average bathroom
+ Same floor as kitchen, and close to library, plodge, laundry/comp. room.

Cons
----

- Faces Front Court. Not as pretty as the garden, and can be a little noisy.
- Noise also comes from the games room from time to time.
- Possibly no Wi-Fi.
- Radiator positioned badly, and is thereore rubbish.
name: G3

body:
G5 is a pretty damn awesome room.

**Good things:** It's got a nice view of the garden with a balcony shared with one other room (H6), it's a good size, it has a big cupboard with lots of lockable storage, etc, etc, etc.

**Bad things:** Creaky floor, creaky bed, creaky walls, creaky ceiling, creaky desk, creaky chairs, creaky bath. Basically this room and all its contents are, on the whole, very creaky.

**Things to note:** Being NW-facing, G5 doesn't get direct sunlight, except for about an hour in the evenings towards the end of Easter term. This is good if you, like me, spent two years being blinded and boiled in south-facing rooms, but is bad if you don't like going outside to sunbathe. It's also good for if you want to face your desk towards the window.

G staircase is brilliant though. Only 10 rooms are inhabited, so there are 5 to a kitchen (both of which are one floor from G5, so take your pick). It's got direct access to the gardens, it's near the library and the plodge, and it's just the right distance from the cafe/bar - close enough that it's not a pain if you forget your wallet, but far enough that the cafe isn't a looming distraction.

If you want to ask about the room, pop an email to cn319; but I don't live there any more, so I can't arrange a visit.

Clive (G5 inhabitant, 2011-12)
name: G5

body:
This room was refurbished in Summer 2013. This means you want this room! **Pros**
  • Excellent view of garden, on shared walkway.
  • New furnishings as of Summer 2013, with a spinny chair!
  • Very nice bathroom with HEATED TOWEL RAIL!!! :D
  • Good amount of holiday storage
  • Great location, lift stops right outside the door, or no more stairs once you're on High Court. Close to bar, JCR, bike shed etc.
  • WiFi access point outside the door
  • Next to kitchen, recycling etc.
  • Insane amount of plug sockets (9!) (10!) and network socket next to desk
  • Guest room next door, so less noise from room parties
  • Lots of floor space for people, clothes, paper...
**Cons**
  • You can just about hear the music in the bar once it gets loud, particularly on karaoke nights. Don't think it would stop you from falling asleep though.
  • Sometimes you get people having conversations on the walkway outside
  • Not quite high enough to get a good amount of natural light
Seriously though, this room is **very** nice, and a great choice if you want a Standard Plus room. Alex (ajb300)
name: Q2

body:
General Information
-------------------

Lockable Overhead locker: Yes
Shelves: 4

As with H1 the balcony is the walkway. This is great if you like being distracted by people walking past, drunken people in the early hours talking in front court, the crazy runaway maintenance/bedders trolley at 8am or if you wish for an easy escape route in the event of a fire or zombie apocalypse (or assassination attempt if you're into that kind of thing).

Two desk chairs are provided. They do not have wheels, an adjustable height or any concept of comfort.

The radiator is located behind the desk, making it particularly difficult to dry clothes and particularly easy to melt computer cables. The room also potentially has the best view of the library in college.

Bathroom
--------

The hot knob on the bath is detachable.
The extraction vent is mould-less (Which is better than can be said for the J13, J14, J15 bathroom last year.)
Bin included.

Kitchen
-------

The modestly sized (room for at least one person) kitchen is on the same floor. The freezer door has broken off.
name: H4

body:
Pretty nice room overall.

Shared bathroom off hallway. Front door on balcony overlooking river and back-door of Set 24. ;)
name: Set 21a

body:
**Pros:**

The rooms on this floor are some of the biggest in the standard price bracket in the college.

There are only 3 people per bathroom, which is a good ratio for the houses.

The kitchen has a real oven!

There is only one small window (albeit with a crack in it).

**Cons:**

Very little noise gets through from the adjacent rooms, but you will hear EVERYTHING from the corridor.

The shower is poor at best, very much a binary temperature system and sometimes it gives up completely with the water pressure being reduced to a dribble.

It is a 2 minute walk from the main college.

The 2nd floor kitchen has a weird sloping ceiling, that chances are (unless you're 5ft or less) you will hit your head on several times over the course of the year.
name: Room 20

body:
Despite sharing a bathroom with two other rooms this room is charged as a Standard room as it's the same size as other standard rooms in college. It has a fairly good wardrobe size but no lockable cupboard for storage over the holidays. It's very convienient for the kitchen which is right next door and a decent size compared to some of the other kitchens in college. 

There's no wifi but the cable plugs in right by the desk so there is no problem with that. 

It's the furthest away from the bar/canteen but this does mean that it's very quiet at night and it's easier to work here then if you are in a room on a walkway.
name: A20

body: Average sized room. Shares a balcony with someone on E staircase. Could complain about the lack of shelving in the bathroom, the distance from the kitchen (2 flights of stairs up and 3 down) and the slightly small wardrobe so not much storage space, but it's an alright room overall. And there's a brand new toilet seat in the bathroom. Excellent! (now 2 years old...)
name: F11

body:
Beautiful room:

 * Really light
 * If re-arrange house keeping's bizarre room arrangement, is spacious and cosy at the same time.
 * Nice view, potentially best in college
 * In summer, you can see who is on the lawn having lunch before deciding when to go down
 * Kitchen (v small) down 1 floor, only bad thing
 * No holiday storage
 * Nice light bathroom and toilet
 * Staircase right opposite library
 * Handy exit at bottom of stairs into garden
 * 4 flights of stairs....but worth it for the haven at the top
name: G11

body:
This room is great! It's a really good size and layout & it has SO much natural light. Because it's on a bend it has 3 windows :) 

No lockable storage space for over the holidays, which is slightly annoying, but fine. You have to walk up about 65 steps to get up here, which is annoying but sure does get you fit fast! Great views of the gardens from the room's balcony.

All in all, a lovely room that anyone should be happy to live in.
name: G10

body: Good sized ensuite with a good amount of sunlight during the day. Second floor up so, even though it's walkway facing, you don't often get people going past. Directly above the bar so can get a little bit of noise when there's karaoke or something on, or when Simon is lugging the beer crates around, but never anything to get too upset about. O staircase also seems to host a piano player somewhere, which can sometimes be a bit of a pain. But most annoying is the infrequent, but ridiculously LOUD, mechanical whirring noise that comes from somewhere below (think it's a fan or something). The wardrobe is only two door, with minimal holiday storage. All really minor gripes and the room is ideally situated in respect of the cafe bar and Garden Restaurant.
name: O8

body:
On the whole R8 is a pretty good place. There is quite a lot of space in the actual room itself, but the wardrobe is quite small. The shower pressure is immense; having a wash is like getting roundhouse-kicked in the face by Chuck Norris. The water temperature control is also quite erratic, with a slight turn of the hot tap transforming luke-warm joy into first degree burns. Both the toilet and the sink perform well in most tested scenarios. The room itself overlooks high court, with a splendid view of Nick Milne's minions at work. 

edit - has just been refurbished, along with rest of R and S. Clean bathroom, floor, curtains, walls etc.
name: R8

body: Really nice room - one of the largest available as standard plus and the ensuite is lovely. Lots of plugs around the room. The wardrobe and overhead cupboard space is considerably larger than most other rooms. Only real issue is the fact that the windows steam up every morning but that is true of all ground floor rooms on this side of college at least. Not an amazing view but the road is fairly obstructed by trees etc, so not a big problem. Wifi can be a bit touch-and-go sometimes so you need a ethernet cable.
name: B3

body:
Quite a good sized ensuite room, although in an L shape, which makes it feel a bit smaller. There's a small built in wardrobe between the two doors but not much hanging space. There's one lockable cupboard above the wardrobe for holiday storage like most rooms.

The window opens onto walkway which can be a bit annoying sometimes, but its not usually a problem, although it can get quite a lot of noise from front court. Not great for daylight as the front of college blocks out a lot, but it does look out onto the stained glass window of the chapel which is quite nice.
name: J5

body: On the same floor as the kitchen which is handy so you don't really need your own mini fridge. Also good that it's first floor - not many stairs and nice view over the gardens. The balcony goes around the whole side of the building and the bit outside this room is really wide so potentially good for the summer. There's a smallish cupboard above the wardrobe that can be locked with a padlock over the holidays to store things which is very useful.
name: H2

body: From the 2009/10 owner: E15 is a marvellous room! Although the view is not garden facing you are high up enough to see over the building opposite so you get a bit of a green view. The balcony door is a bit funny and needs a good push now and again but you'll get used to it. Everything else is pretty standard although there's a small pot noodle stain on the carpet (sorry future room owners). Also, never a problem with noise (you don't hear pianos), its near the kitchen and Satin is alleged to live next door in E14. The balcony is shared the with the owner of D18.
name: E15

body:
Room 19:

Apparently the best room in the grad house --

Bring a bright light like most rooms in college, this room has windows on two sides, but they're a little small. Room is a good size, space for 4 chairs, 2 tables, a desk, 2 shelves, wardrobes, sink...

Seems quite good compared to most rooms - it's looking a little tired, but then it is a student room in college!

Location: may put you off, 5 mins from food (ie canteen)
Noise: fine if you know who you're living with, just don't live adjacent to party people! I imagine similar to the other houses for general noise insulation...

Overall happy! (I was top of room ballot so anything else would have been a failure...)
name: Room 19

body:
Bed is positioned next to the wall, other side of which is the shower/sink - can get frustrating if the occupant of L10 enjoys singing very loudly whilst washing.

Window looks out onto the impending doom of the UL tower which can be mildly depressing at times. Shares a balcony with someone on K staircase. Balcony position very useful for seeing if people have started queuing for brunch, or to throw things at people in the smoking area.

No holiday storage. Strong Wifi (Lapwing) which is a bonus.

There was initially no mirror fixed to the wall. I bought a fancy new one and didn't take it home with me - if you're lucky it may well still be there. If not, maintenance said they'll give you a new one in exchange for a packet of HobNobs.
- It's still there. I thought maintenace was being extremely nice.

Closest kitchen is up one flight of stairs on the top floor.

There are hooks in the walls for anybody with large frames.
name: L9

body:
Lighting is pretty terrible although I guess if I could be arsed to ask the porter I'm sure it would be sorted. View of UL is quite nice, especiialy sunrise. Door/window thing doesn't leak which is always a plus.

Bed is very squeaky as two of the slats have broken (again I could probably get this fixed if I wanted to).

Wifi signal is strong (although the wifi is patchy as hell right now so I stick to wired).
name: O9

body:
Nice view of the garden - but this does mean it can get dark and dingy (two plants have died from lack of light). Very cold in winter. No wifi signal, but phone signal only good near window. There is holiday storage above the wardrobe, but this is in the hallway outside the main room and is a bit on the small side, especially considering the massive room.
Also handy for the kitchen, which is just opposite.
name: C1

body:
Good sized room, with a reasonable sized overhead locker for storage during the holidays. Balcony is the walkway, so doesn't really have a balcony, and can sometimes be distracting when people are constatntly walking past. Also problematic in terms of a privacy/natural light trade-off. I went for nudity over sunlight. Opposite the library, not the best view but possibly the required inspiration to do some work. On the same floor as the kitchen, which is handy and not many stairs to climb to reach it. Plenty of light. All in all a pretty decent room.

Incidentally, Robert Webb once lived in this room.
name: H1

body:
General Information
-------------------
The room is reasonably sized and fairly standard for a standard plus. The available balcony doubles up as a walkway to other staircases, but is occasionally used by others. However as it is the second floor, far fewer people will pass by the room, meaning oppurtunities to catch people and accuse them of tresspassing are limited.

Views range from a wall, to another wall, to the university library if viewed from certain angles. One of the balcony lights shines slightly off centre to the window, acting as either a nightlight or an annoyance.

Like a lot of the rooms in L staircase, the floor is very squeeky in the middle. As worrying at this may sound, it at least appears to be structurally sound as I have yet to fall through the floor into the room below and extensive tests have been made to make sure that this will not happen.

The room comes with bed included (some assembly may be required). There are also some walls and a ceiling.

Bathroom
--------
The bathroom is fully functioning for the most part, although the hot water doesn't seem to work before about 9:00 which is obviously no good if you have early lectures. The mirror is not above the sink and is on a different wall instead, often resulting in an increased mess on the floor. There is a ridge on the floor that water has a habit of accumlating into. Unlike some other rooms, the showerhead is firmly attached and will not fall on your head at the end of your shower. The toilet flushes.

Kitchen
-------
The kitchen is located almost directly beneath the room and contains enough room for one person, so long as they are under 6 ft tall. The fridge has the unusual ability to chill meats (and only meats) to sub zero temperatures. It has also been known to make food vanish, but this is probably due to food thieves. Contrary to popular belief, the microwave can be used as an oven.
name: L5

body:
Decent holiday storage and hanging space (its got a little corridor with wardrobes & overhead locker as you walk in like quite a few rooms do). The bathroom has a handy shelf above the toilet and sink. Got a balcony shared with someone on P staircase. Doesn't currently get Wifi (strong enough to make much use of anyway). Balcony is standard size, but has been known to hold 30 people (Ryan counted) and the Porters don't like it if you get portered by a guest...

Hannis (jwfw2).

![View from balcony][1]


  [1]: http://i.imgur.com/40Gy7.jpg
name: Q5

body: As you go into the room the bathroom door and the wardrobe are on either side, then you go through the inner door to the rest of the room. 3-door wardrobe with big overhead locker so plenty of holiday storage. Only problem with bathroom is it doesn't have a big shelf behind the sink. Room is light with desk by the balcony doors, which open onto walkway (but people very rarely walk past). Nice view of the gardens. B staircase is fairly quiet, no noise form bar/bops. Rooms either side have pianos, but it's not ususally a problem
name: B4

body:
Benefits:

 + colour of the walls. Sounds weird, but it's actually a great lilac colour that is really lovely.
 + good view of the trees and the bridge; babbling brook sounds for those who are particularly water-mad.
 + Whoever was in this room before me left lots of hooks all over the place, rather handy.
 + Shower is of good intensity.

Burden: 

 - spiderwebs in the crook of the balcony window that just DO NOT GO AWAY - and be sure to keep your window closed at night, the amount of insects that invade your room (and then dive into your lamps to die) is ridiculous.
 - The outer door is about half an inch off the floor - maintenance have put a draught excluder on but it still lets out a bit of heat, and noise from J staircase filters in a fair bit.
 - The light in the main room is a bit dim.
name: J6

body:
Upside:

- pretty spacious
- nice garden view
- mild to strong wifi reception
- right above college bar!

Downside:

- coming with proximity to the bar is noise.
- balcony is shared.
- wardrobe area lacks lighting.
- book racks and the desk are on the opposite sides of the room.

jky20
name: O2

body: No lockable cupboard. Must have one of the best views from its balcony in college. There is a lift on K, so being on the fourth floor isn't a bad thing, just means it is quieter :)
name: K10

body:
Good sized room. long and thin, as opposed to square. good over-head locker space and reasonable sized wardrobe. good location - between library and cafe. Lift is a real plus when moving in and out - even when your'e only on the first floor! Good sized kitchen on first floor. Door out to the shared balcony/walk way overlooking the gardens - if you can be bothered to buy some plastic furniture it could be lovely in the summer. Good sized bathroom - with no lingering weird smell.
There's no piano on the staircase which is lucky! Good wifi and phone reception. 
It is next to the bedders' cupboard - this was only a problem in Michaelmas term as lots of bedders congregated for a coffee and a chat - I had a new bedder for Lent term and she doesn't have everyone round so it's fine! and, being opposite the chapel sometimes choir can be a bit loud - but it's quite nice to listen really 
Generally very happy on this staircase
name: K3

body: There is rust in the bath and sink.
name: O6

body:
Pros:

 - Very close to the Bar, Garden Restaurant, JCR etc.
 - Refurbished Summer 2013: new bathroom with heated towel rail, new desk chair and armchair, new carpet, new mattress, new kettle, new blackout curtains.
 - Morning sun, light room
 - Some holiday storage
 - Plenty of shelving
 - Strong Wi-Fi Signal

Cons:

 - Not a particularly quiet room: music can be heard from the bar on some evenings
 - On a walkway, rather than a balcony (although you're on the second floor so its not too busy)
 - Small cupboard
 - If you cook, the kitchen is on the floor below
name: P5

body:
S2 is a good sized ensuite room. It has a large wardrobe along with a larger amount of holiday storage. The room is a bit of an awkward shape, but comes with two sets of windows. It's on the end of the college so only shares a wall with one other room. The balcony is the 1st floor back walkway, which happens to be quite large outside S2. As for daylight, it's not fantastic as the balcony of the room above blocks out some of the light but it's alright. The network connection socket is on the other side of the room compared with the desk which is a pain, but you can just about get wireless if you put your laptop on the floor!

Any questions, feel free to email me on lw358

Luke
name: S2

body: Good room that stays fairly cool in Summer (east facing). Only downside is the less than inspiring view of the Catering Office.
name: R4

body:
- Big room with 2 windows and a set of double doors onto a patio, all facing the garden, so good daylight.
 - No ensuite or sink, but there is a toilet across the hall and a bathroom upstairs
 - There is a large wardrobe, so lots of hanging space, and a dresser with some drawers for folded clothes.
 - No vacation storage in the room.
 - Furniture: wardrobe, dresser, 1 coffee table, 1 chair, (as well as 1 desk chair, desk, bed, bookshelf, bedside table)
 - Wifi router outside the door can be fairly noisy
 - Next to kitchen

A (now slightly dated) 360 degree view of the room (flattened, so imagine rolling it into a circle)
![360 Panorama][1]


  [1]: http://i.imgur.com/Jzsjo.jpg
name: Room 3

body: One of the smaller standards in college, but still room to get everything in. Has a nice view of the gardens, bridge and Adams Road houses. Unfortunately there is only one potential bed space which is along the wall with the kitchen on the other side, so if anyone is using the kitchen late at night, you will here it. No overhead locker for vacation storage. Room is really warm, even when the radiator is on low in winter, because it gets sun all day. However, the sun shines straight onto the desk so you need to have one of the curtains closed during the middle of the day to avoid blindness. Overall, a pretty decent room, but nothing special.
name: R15

body:
Big for a Standard Plus room. Loads of floor space, handy shelves and an overhead locker above the wardrobe. Heavy door to separate main room from wardrobe/bathroom area in case of zombie outbreak. The window faces the balcony of Set 30, so if you know the people living there you can communicate via frantic semaphore.

Being on the end of High Court, it's a bit out of most people's way. But it's also really, really quiet, even with the Music Room right there. You can hear the Bops, but then so can people in Norway. Wifi access is there but very weak, you're better off with a cable. Although it could be that my computer is just rubbish.

As of 17/05/10, this room has been officially designated a Sex Designated Terrain by the RCSA President, which may slightly reduce its market value.
name: S6

body:
Ok, so this might be a little out of date, because I lived there in 2008/9. But here goes.

D16 is a pretty good example of a standard price band shared bathroom room. It is garden facing, which is better, because the ones on that side of college are slightly bigger and also have the overhead lockable storage that D15 and others of that type don't have. And it doesn't get stupidly hot in the summer, because it's North facing. D staircase is a bit of a walk from anywhere worth being in college, but its not a proper trek, so its tolerable.

I liked it so much that I got another similar room (I10) this year. More excitingly however, D16 is better than I10 for several reasons.

1. The walls are the more attractive pale yellow colour rather than the blue.
2. The mirror is on the wall by the wardrobe, sensible if you want to look at yourself as you put on your clothes.
3. With the desk in the position it is supplied in, you only need a short cable to attach your laptop to the handily located socket.
4. Unless whoever lives there this year manages to lose it, this room still has its kitchen cupboard key. So you can leave your pasta in the kitchen with the confidence that it is safely locked away.
name: D16

body:
Good sized square room, plenty of storage (big 3 door wardrobe with overhead lockers for the holidays in the little hall as you go in). Ensuite. Looks onto the garden, doors onto a walkway (but no one ever walks past). Quiet area of college. Plenty of light to work in since the desk is by double patio doors. Its really easy to move in as its by the gate onto Herschel Rd, and only one flight of stairs,

Downsides: Its quite far to walk to the bar/restaurant, but I'm being picky - its a really lovely room!
name: B9

body: A standard room, with a fair amount of space and front balcony. In very close proximity to the bar and Garden Restaurant, but this does mean you can hear people talking outside the bar after closing. Saying that, being on the third floor means you are actually quite far from any chatter and you should be able to go out like a light if you've been working your little cotton socks off all day long. There is no overhead storage in this room. However, there is a **simply fantastic** kettle with **serious evaporating action** that will be able to make you **hot beverages galore**!
name: M9

body: Great room. Really big for a college room. Good bathroom, shower has really good water pressure. Only one window which opens out onto the large first level balconies and walkways which mean it can get a bit dark given the size of the room. Other than that the only drawback is that noise from front court comes straight up if the staircase doors are left open (which is pretty much all the time). Right next door to the kitchen which is convenient but it can be noisy (and smelly if someone burns something!)
name: J3

body:
Previous complaints from fellow who lives underneath about noise
Sometimes noisy living next to the organ scholar, who plays the piano all the time
Light level could be a bit lot better but not terrible!
Next to the bedkeeper's cupboard....and they wake you up every morning with all their noise and non-stop talking/gossiping in Polish
Occasional spiders (but not a problem if you like them!)
name: F5

body: A really good room as it's a pretty decent size without feeling too empty. It's a best room so you pay quite a lot for it given that it's not as big as some other best rooms. However it is right next door to the bathroom so is basically en-suite and has access to the single best kitchen anywhere in college just downstairs (and it's only used by another 5 people). Also as it's not on the same corridor as the other rooms it is much quieter then living on the main corridor whilst still being really close to everyone else. All in all a very good room and well worth the price.
name: Room 7

body:
This is an average sized standard room but there is a massive partition down the middle of the room on one side for no reason whatsoever, which does limit space a fair bit. It also means that you don't get much sunlight on one half of the room. Not only that but since all but one of the walls is at an angle (it's an attic room) the furniture simply doesn't fit in the room properly. No mirror.

There is an upstairs bathroom next door.
name: Room 14

body:
Fair size, very light. Overhead storage in the form of a good sized loft, provided you can fit the boxes though the small opening to it (Just watch out for the insulation as it makes for extreme itchiness if it gets on your clothes. not wanting to put you off or anything...). THE BEST views of the garden from the balcony, shared with N14. Very easy access to kitchen which has a skylight to get rid of that smoke when you invariably burn your toast when hungry after a night out.   Perfect for access to Bar. cafe, garden restaurant, JCR and party room (so pretty much everything you might want to be close to), especially if it's raining (you don't have to go outside). Although above the bar, it is very quiet and you can only hear people in the bar when it's karaoke night (even then, I slept through a whole karaoke night here).

If you like 4 flights of stairs, then it is the best place to be :)

Bryn Pickering (bp325) 10/02/2011
name: N13

body: D staircase is on Herschel Court.
name: Staircase D
